Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TSimpleSetFactory

java.lang.Object
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TAbstractSetFactory
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TSimpleSetFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISetFactory, java.lang.Runnable
public class TSimpleSetFactory
extends TAbstractSetFactory
TSimpleSetFactory object implements the simplest heuristic to generate series of cards. It simply generates a series of six cards at a time, without any "quality" check regarding the distribution of the numbers between the cards of different series. MaxEPC and MAxEPR values are not used, that is they can be considered as always set, respectively, to 15 and 5.
Since:
1.8
Version:
1.1
Author:
Harry G. Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
See Also:
TMakeSix, TAbstractSetFactory, ISetFactory

    Constructors

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getMaxEqualPerCard()
    This "quality parameter" is not used by this heuristic, so this method return always 15.
    int getMaxEqualPerRow()
    This "quality parameter" is not used by this heuristic, so this method return always 5.
    java.lang.String getMethodName()
    Return a symbolic name identifying the used heuristic algorithm.
    void run()
    This method implements the simple loop needed to create the desired number of card series. There is no quality check on generated cards, that is series are generated randomly using the configured TMakeSix series builder object, and no comparison is made between cards belonging to different series. See TProgressiveSetFactory for something more interesting!

    Methods inherited from class harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TAbstractSetFactory

    checkForStop, checkInitialization, getDesideredSeries, getElapsedMillisecs, getIterationsLimit, getLogger, getSeriesBuilder, getSeriesList, getStatus, getTimeLimit, joinOnEnded, joinOnEnded, requestStart, requestStop, setDesiredSeries, setIterationsLimit, setLogger, setMaxEqualPerCard, setMaxEqualPerRow, setSeriesBuilder, setSeriesList, setTimeLimit

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • run

      public void run()
      This method implements the simple loop needed to create the desired number of card series. There is no quality check on generated cards, that is series are generated randomly using the configured TMakeSix series builder object, and no comparison is made between cards belonging to different series. See TProgressiveSetFactory for something more interesting!
